0.hint: All other figures are divided into equal parts.

1.hint: Figure (1) and fig. (3) can be rotated into each other and fig. (4) and fig. (5) can be rotated into each other.

2.hint: Each one of the figures except fig. (2), consists of five arrowheads.

3.hint: In each one of the figures except fig. (5), two arrows point towards left and one arrow points towards right

4.hint: Only in fig. (4), both the parallel lines are bent in the same direction {i.e. towards the left}.

5.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

6.hint: Only in fig. (3), the line segment is not a diameter of the circle.

7.hint: Figure (4) has a rectangle in place of a '+' sign

8.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

9.hint: In each one of the figures except fig. (3), the two crosses (x) appear in the diagonally opposite corners.

10.hint: Figure (4) is formed by four line segments while each one of the other figures is formed by three line segments.

11.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

12.hint: In each one of the figures, except fig. (2), the number of sides in the inner element is one more than the number of sides in the outer element.

13.hint: Fig. (3) is formed by a combination of A-shaped elements while all other figures are formed by a combination of V-shaped elements.

15.hint: Each one of the figures, except fig. (4), is formed by three line segments.

17.hint: All other figures contain a geometrical figure along with its mirror image.

19.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

20.hint: In each one of the other figures, one of the two elements is made of dotted lines

21.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

22.hint: In all other figures, all the line segments are drawn perpendicular to one base only.

23.hint: Each one of the figures except fig. (2), contains - one complete square, one cup-shaped element having three sides, one 'U-shaped element having two sides and one straight line.

24.hint: Only in fig. (2), while moving in an ACW direction, the numbers do not form a sequence.

25.hint: In all other figures, one of the dots lies outside the triangle as well as the circle.

26.hint: In fig. (3), the arrow indicates an ACW motion while in each of the other figures, the arrow indicates a CW motion.

27.hint: Each one of the figures except fig. (2), is obtained by the lateral inversion of an English alphabet.

29.hint: Only in fig. (4), the dot appears in the region common to all the three circles.

30.hint: Only in fig. (4), the pin passes through a vertex of each one of the two elements.

31.hint: Only in fig. (4), the black triangle and the black circle lie at the two ends of the same diameter.

32.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

33.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

34.hint: Each one of the remaining figures is composed of straight lines only.

35.hint: Only in fig. (3), the marked angles are unequal.

36.hint: Only in fig. (4), all the four cup-shaped elements are opening in different directions.

37.hint: In all other figures, the lower element is an alphabet and the upper element is a number which indicates the position of the lower element in the set of English alphabet.

38.hint: Except fig. (4), in all other figures, the elements are arranged in the increasing order of the number of sides sequentially, either in a CW or in an ACW direction.

39.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

40.hint: Except fig. (4), in all other figures, one of the two arrows points towards the centre of the circle.

41.hint: The line segment inside the square is attached to the corner which lies opposite to the corner to which the outer L-shaped element is attached.

42.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

43.hint: Only in fig. (4), each side of the square has at one black triangle attached to it.

44.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

45.hint: Only in fig. (1), two of the four elements are oriented in the same direction.

46.hint: In all other figures, none of the elements in at the central position and all the elements are arranged at the outer positions with the two types of elements appearing alternately.

47.hint: In all other figures, the two double sided arrows intersect each other at right angles.

48.hint: Only in this figure, the two arrows are not at right angles.

49.hint: In all other figures, each element is obtained by rotating the adjacent element through 180o.

50.hint: The two dots lie on the same side of the diagonal only in fig. (4).

51.hint: In each one of the other figures, the small line segment lies one space ahead of the dot, in a CW direction.

52.hint: In all other figures, the dot appears in the same corner of the square as the line outside it.

53.hint: In all other figures, both the arrowheads lie towards the diameter of the semicircle.

54.hint: In all other figures, the line is bent towards the pin.

55.hint: Only in fig. (5), the small line segment lies on the same side (right side) of the main figure as the head of the pin (or all other figures can be rotated into each other)

56.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

57.hint: Only in fig. (3), two out of the four elements are opening in the same direction.

58.hint: Only fig. (5) consists of equal number of black and white pins.

59.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

60.hint: Only fig. (4) contains three diameters of the circle.

61.hint: The inclination of the triangle is different in fig. (4).

62.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

63.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

65.hint: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

88.hint: The question figure is rotated clockwise through 90 degrees each time.

89.hint: C and E are the only two pictures which are identical

92.hint: lines across proceed +1,+2,+3. Lines down proceed +3,+2,+1
